EOF
\)")

Bash(CYROID_USERNAME=jon CYROID_PASSWORD=password docker-compose exec -T api python3 -c "
import requests
import time
import sys
import os

API_BASE = ''http://localhost:8000/api/v1''
USERNAME = ''jon''
PASSWORD = ''password''


def get_token\(\):
    print\(''Authenticating...''\)
    resp = requests.post\(
        f''{API_BASE}/auth/login'',
        json={''username'': USERNAME, ''password'': PASSWORD}
    \)
    if resp.status_code != 200:
        print\(f''Login failed: {resp.status_code} - {resp.text}''\)
        sys.exit\(1\)

    token = resp.json\(\).get\(''access_token''\)
    print\(f''  ✓ Authenticated as {USERNAME}''\)
    return token


def headers\(token\):
    return {''Authorization'': f''Bearer {token}''}


def create_test_range\(token, name, subnet_base\):
    print\(f''\\nCreating range: {name}''\)
    resp = requests.post\(
        f''{API_BASE}/ranges'',
        headers=headers\(token\),
        json={''name'': name, ''description'': ''Test range''}
    \)
    if resp.status_code not in [200, 201]:
        print\(f''  ✗ Failed to create range: {resp.status_code} - {resp.text}''\)
        return None
    range_data = resp.json\(\)
    range_id = range_data[''id'']
    print\(f''  ✓ Created range: {range_id[:8]}...''\)
    
    # Create networks
    for i, net_name in enumerate\([''corporate'', ''dmz'']\):
        resp = requests.post\(
            f''{API_BASE}/ranges/{range_id}/networks'',
            headers=headers\(token\),
            json={
                ''name'': net_name,
                ''subnet'': f''{subnet_base}.{i}.0/24'',
                ''gateway'': f''{subnet_base}.{i}.1'',
                ''is_isolated'': False
            }
        \)
        if resp.status_code not in [200, 201]:
            print\(f''  ✗ Failed to create network {net_name}: {resp.status_code}''\)
        else:
            print\(f''  ✓ Created network: {net_name}''\)
    return range_id


def create_blueprint\(token, range_id, name, prefix\):
    print\(f''\\nCreating blueprint: {name}''\)
    resp = requests.post\(
        f''{API_BASE}/blueprints'',
        headers=headers\(token\),
        json={
            ''name'': name,
            ''description'': ''Test blueprint'',
            ''range_id'': range_id,
            ''base_subnet_prefix'': prefix
        }
    \)
    if resp.status_code not in [200, 201]:
        print\(f''  ✗ Failed: {resp.status_code} - {resp.text}''\)
        return None
    bp = resp.json\(\)
    print\(f''  ✓ Created: {bp[""id""][:8]}... \(next_offset={bp.get\(""next_offset"", 0\)}\)''\)
    return bp[''id'']


def deploy_instance\(token, blueprint_id, name\):
    print\(f''\\nDeploying instance: {name}''\)
    resp = requests.post\(
        f''{API_BASE}/blueprints/{blueprint_id}/deploy'',
        headers=headers\(token\),
        json={''name'': name, ''auto_deploy'': False}
    \)
    if resp.status_code not in [200, 201]:
        print\(f''  ✗ Failed: {resp.status_code} - {resp.text}''\)
        return None
    inst = resp.json\(\)
    print\(f''  ✓ Instance: offset={inst[""subnet_offset""]}''\)
    return inst


def get_networks\(token, range_id\):
    resp = requests.get\(f''{API_BASE}/ranges/{range_id}/networks'', headers=headers\(token\)\)
    return resp.json\(\) if resp.status_code == 200 else []


def cleanup\(token, ranges, blueprints\):
    print\(''\\n=== Cleanup ===''\)
    for bp_id in blueprints:
        resp = requests.get\(f''{API_BASE}/blueprints/{bp_id}/instances'', headers=headers\(token\)\)
        if resp.status_code == 200:
            for inst in resp.json\(\):
                requests.delete\(f''{API_BASE}/ranges/{inst[""range_id""]}'', headers=headers\(token\)\)
                print\(f''  Deleted range {inst[""range_id""][:8]}''\)
        requests.delete\(f''{API_BASE}/blueprints/{bp_id}'', headers=headers\(token\)\)
        print\(f''  Deleted blueprint {bp_id[:8]}''\)
    for rid in ranges:
        requests.delete\(f''{API_BASE}/ranges/{rid}'', headers=headers\(token\)\)
        print\(f''  Deleted range {rid[:8]}''\)


# Run test
print\(''='' * 60\)
print\(''CYROID Multi-Range Network Isolation Test''\)
print\(''='' * 60\)

token = get_token\(\)
ranges = []
blueprints = []

try:
    # Create source range
    src_id = create_test_range\(token, ''isolation-test-source'', ''10.100''\)
    if not src_id:
        sys.exit\(1\)
    ranges.append\(src_id\)
    
    # Create blueprint
    bp_id = create_blueprint\(token, src_id, ''isolation-test-bp'', ''10.100''\)
    if not bp_id:
        sys.exit\(1\)
    blueprints.append\(bp_id\)
    
    # Deploy 3 instances
    instances = []
    for i in range\(3\):
        inst = deploy_instance\(token, bp_id, f''test-inst-{i+1}''\)
        if inst:
            instances.append\(inst\)
            ranges.append\(inst[''range_id'']\)
    
    # Verify
    print\(''\\n'' + ''='' * 60\)
    print\(''VERIFICATION''\)
    print\(''='' * 60\)
    
    all_subnets = set\(\)
    conflicts = False
    
    for inst in instances:
        print\(f''\\nInstance offset={inst[""subnet_offset""]}:''\)
        nets = get_networks\(token, inst[''range_id'']\)
        expected_octet = 100 + inst[''subnet_offset'']
        for net in nets:
            subnet = net[''subnet'']
            if subnet in all_subnets:
                print\(f''  ✗ CONFLICT: {net[""name""]}: {subnet}''\)
                conflicts = True
            else:
                all_subnets.add\(subnet\)
                actual_octet = int\(subnet.split\(''.''\)[1]\)
                if actual_octet == expected_octet:
                    print\(f''  ✓ {net[""name""]}: {subnet}''\)
                else:
                    print\(f''  ✗ {net[""name""]}: {subnet} \(expected 10.{expected_octet}.x.x\)''\)
    
    print\(''\\n'' + ''='' * 60\)
    print\(''RESULT''\)
    print\(''='' * 60\)
    print\(f''Unique subnets: {len\(all_subnets\)} \(expected 6\)''\)
    print\(f''Conflicts: {conflicts}''\)
    
    if len\(all_subnets\) == 6 and not conflicts:
        print\(''\\n✓ ALL TESTS PASSED''\)
    else:
        print\(''\\n✗ TESTS FAILED''\)

finally:
    cleanup\(token, ranges, blueprints\)
")
Bash(do echo "=== $net ===" docker network inspect "$net" --format '{{range .IPAM.Config}}{{.Subnet}}{{end}}' done)

Bash(# Update version
echo ""0.11.2"" > backend/VERSION

# Stage the changes
git add backend/cyroid/api/ranges.py  backend/cyroid/services/dind_service.py  backend/cyroid/services/range_deployment_service.py  backend/cyroid/tasks/deployment.py  backend/VERSION

# Commit
git commit -m ""$\(cat <<''EOF''
fix: wire up DinD-based range deployment

- Update ranges.py deploy endpoint to use RangeDeploymentService
  instead of legacy VyOS-based deployment
- Fix dind_service.py wait logic - create DockerClient inside retry
  loop since it connects on initialization
- Fix range_deployment_service.py to use template.base_image instead
  of non-existent template.image attribute
- Update deployment.py task to use DinD deployment service

Ranges now deploy inside isolated DinD containers with their own
Docker networks and VMs, providing proper network isolation between
concurrent range instances.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)"")

Bash(git -C /Users/JonWFH/jondev/CYROID commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
feat: enhance Snapshot model with metadata for VM Library

Add VM metadata fields to Snapshot model so snapshots can be used as
sources for creating new VMs in the VM Library feature:
- Make vm_id optional \(snapshots can exist independently\)
- Add docker_image_tag for full image reference
- Add os_type and vm_type for VM classification
- Add default_cpu, default_ram_mb, default_disk_gb specs
- Add display_type and vnc_port configuration
- Add is_global flag for visibility control
- Add tags JSON field for categorization
- Add index on name field for faster lookups
- Change foreign key from CASCADE to SET NULL \(preserve snapshots\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git -C /Users/JonWFH/jondev/CYROID commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
test: add VM Library integration tests

Add comprehensive integration tests for the VM Library feature:

- test_create_vm_from_snapshot: Verify VMs can be created from snapshots
- test_create_vm_requires_template_or_snapshot: Validation for VM creation
- test_create_vm_cannot_have_both_template_and_snapshot: Mutual exclusivity
- test_promote_image_to_library: Admin can promote cached images
- test_promote_image_requires_admin: Non-admin users are rejected
- test_deployment_validation: Range pre-deployment validation works
- test_deployment_validation_with_vms: Validation with snapshot-based VMs
- test_deployment_validation_nonexistent_range: 404 for missing ranges
- test_get_vm_shows_snapshot_info: VM GET returns snapshot source
- test_list_vms_includes_snapshot_vms: VM LIST includes snapshot VMs

Also fixes SQLAlchemy foreign_keys relationship definitions in VM and
Snapshot models that were causing mapper initialization failures.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
